title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 May 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:00 <ries> sdumitriu: exceptions : javax.servlet.ServletException: com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException: Error number 3 in 0: Could not initialize main XWiki context  
00:00 <@sdumitriu> Full error?  
00:00 <ries> But, I think I see what's going on… the document suggest to create a connection pool  
00:00 <@sdumitriu> Right, that means database connection isn't properly configured  
00:00 <ries> however, I think I need to edit hibernate.cfg.xml  ...  
00:01 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
00:01 <ries> The document suggests that the conneciton pool is enough, and a jndi lookup will find jndi/xwikipool  
00:01 <ries> set, let me fix that  
00:04 <vmassol> has quit  
00:12 <ries> sdumitriu: Ahaaaaa!! works  
00:13 <@sdumitriu> Good  
00:13 <ries> sdumitriu: my logfile does get filled with these : http://pastebin.com/C4KWAZKJ  
00:13 <ries> at blazing speed..  
00:15 <@sdumitriu> Doesn't seem to be related to XWiki, it's a glassfish issue...  
00:15 <@sdumitriu> Can't help further, I've only tried Glassfish twice  
00:15 <ries> sdumitriu: I will look into it...  
00:15 <ries> see what I can find  
00:45 <ries> sdumitriu: I restarted my server and the messages are gone, after redeployment  
00:47 <ssavi> has left #xwiki

20:32 <vmassol> Failed tests:   testGetTemporaryDirectoryFailOver(org.xwiki.environment.internal.StandardEnvironmentTest): unexpected invocation: logger.warn("Falling back on [{}] for {} directory.", "/var/folders/v9/\_395qc791vz23qdwyptvs06m0000gn/T/", "permanent")(..)  
20:32 <vmassol> haven't checked why  
20:32 <vmassol> got to go, bfn  
20:32 <vmassol> has quit  
20:46 <ries> has left #xwiki  
20:52 <ries> has joined #xwiki  
20:56 <ssavi> Hi  sdumitriu  
20:56 <ssavi> I'm not quite sure on how to write unit test for mime type.  
21:07 <ries> Hello! Would xwiki be suitable for creating good looking documentation in PDF form? (Not like print screens style...)  
21:18 <@sdumitriu> Hi ssavi  
21:18 <@sdumitriu> I'll answer ries first  
21:18 <@sdumitriu> Hi ries  
21:18 <ssavi> Yeah sure  
21:19 <@sdumitriu> Well, it depends on how much time do you have to invest in customizing the PDF export  
21:20 <@sdumitriu> You can check how a normal PDF looks like, for example try http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting?xpage=pdfoptions  
21:21 <@sdumitriu> My answer would be Yes, XWiki is very good for writing documentation, but it might need some tweaking to get some really good looking PDFs  
21:22 <@sdumitriu> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Configuration#HCustomizingthePDFexportLook26Feel describes in more detail how can you customize the PDF  
21:25 <@sdumitriu> ssavi: You modified AttachmentData for indexing the mimetype, right?  
21:25 <ssavi> yep  
21:26 <@sdumitriu> There is already a test class for AttachmentData  
21:26 <@sdumitriu> So you'll add a new method there  
21:27 <@sdumitriu> In that method you'll call addDataToLuceneDocument, and then check if after that the lucene Document object has a field called "mimetype"  
21:27 <ssavi> I added these lines in the test class as it  was throwing some build errrors  
21:27 <ssavi> Mock mockServletContext = mock(ServletContext.class);  
21:27 <ssavi>         mockServletContext.stubs().method("getMimeType").will(returnValue("default"));  
21:27 <ssavi>         XWikiServletContext xwikiServletContext = new XWikiServletContext((ServletContext) mockServletContext.proxy());  
21:27 <ssavi>         getContext().setEngineContext(xwikiServletContext);  
21:28 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
21:28 <@sdumitriu> That's the right approach  
21:28 <ssavi> .k thanks  
21:28 <@sdumitriu> But you should be more specific, instead of returning "default" you should specify something like:  
21:28 <ries> sdumitriu: Currently for our open source project we are using mediawiki, but I am less than satisified by it… For work we where looking for a java based wiki and I was shoked to see how much xwiki was advanced  
21:29 <ries> So now I am temted to think to revisit the decission of using mediawiki  
21:29 <ries> the PDF looks already pretty nice  
21:29 <ries> and, I have no problem making changes to customize...  
21:29 <ries> We don't have much yet, but this is our current wiki : http://wiki.librecad.org/index.php/Main\_Page  
21:32 <@sdumitriu> ssavi:  
21:32 <@sdumitriu>         mockServletContext.stubs().method("getMimeType").with(eq("txt.txt")).will(returnValue("text/plain"));  
21:34 <ssavi> sdumitriu: Ah.. I get that. Thanks a lot sergiu  
21:34 <@sdumitriu> ssavi: You're welcome  
21:35 <@sdumitriu> I sent a reply to your API proposal  
21:35 <@sdumitriu> ries: Switching wikis is something that you should consider carefully together with the rest of your community  
21:35 <ries> sdumitriu: it's still a very young wiki...  
21:36 <ries> so, it's still a good time to switch  
21:36 <@sdumitriu> It's not as simple as "the new wiki has more features", since your users might have to learn a new wiki syntax, a new UI, and so on  
21:37 <@sdumitriu> Although Mediawiki isn't as featured as other wikis, it's still the most popular one and thus it's the one that most people already know how to use  
21:37 <@sdumitriu> I've seen mixed results with XWiki, some say it's very easy to use, but some (especially non technical people) say that it's a bit confusing  
21:37 <@sdumitriu> I guess you won't have that many non-technical users, though  
21:38 <ries> I found it very hard to do anything really well on mediawiki… I come from a CMS space though and wiki's still look a bit odd to me.  
21:38 <@sdumitriu> You should start with a parallel setup to let users see how they get along with XWiki for a few weeks  
21:38 <ries> However, when looked for my work for 'something' to document on, I found that xwiki was just much more advanced...  
21:39 <ries> for the next couple of week I am going to play with xwiki  
21:40 <ries> , to make the documentation I am currently making in pages and send around as PDF into xwiki  
21:40 <ries> See how that goes  
21:40 <@sdumitriu> Don't hesitate to ask for help here  
21:40 <ries> I won't! That's why I was getting here yesterday  
21:41 <@sdumitriu> Well, you have to find a time when some devs are online  
21:41 <@sdumitriu> If nobody answers, try again later  
21:43 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
21:43 <ries> sdumitriu: yup…. I ususally hang out a lot on IRC, our project is at #librecad  
22:07 <ries> I am following this guide : http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/ImportExport  
22:07 <ries> But after I uploaded th xae, I don't get thelist of available packages  
22:10 <@sdumitriu> Did you click on the file name?  
22:10 <@sdumitriu> gtg, bbl  
22:11 <ries> sdumitriu: filename isn't even shown..  
23:49 <vmassol> has quit
